data.event: Adrian was founded on June 18, 1826 by Addison Comstock, promoter of the Erie and Kalamazoo Railroad, and was originally named Logan.
In 1828 Addison's wife renamed the village to Adrian after the Roman Emperor Hadrian.

event.title: manufactured in Adrian during those 12 years

data.event: Between 1900 and 1912, Adrian was shaping up to be one of the motor capitals of the world, with three car models manufactured in Adrian during those 12 years.
